messages.content: ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo is an extension for ComfyUI that adds undo and redo functionality.
As of Nov 28, 2023, ComfyUI has built-in undo/redo functionality, making the ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo extension obsolete.
What should users do with ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo after updating ComfyUI?
After updating ComfyUI, users should remove or disable the ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo extension to avoid conflicts with the built-in undo/redo functionality.
How can users completely remove ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo?

To completely remove ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo, users may need to delete the ZZZ-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo folder inside the web/extensions directory. The latest version of the extension will delete this folder after starting ComfyUI.
What if users want to keep using ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo?
If users wish to keep using ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo, they will have to remove the undoRedo.js file from the web/extensions/core directory.
What are the default keyboard shortcuts for undo and redo in ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo?
In ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo, the default keyboard shortcut for undo is Ctrl/⌘ + Z, and for redo, it is Ctrl/⌘ + Y or Ctrl/⌘ + Shift + Z.
How does the repeat function work for undo/redo in ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo?
In ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo, keeping the undo/redo keyboard shortcut keys pressed will repeat the undo/redo operation at an ever-increasing pace.

ComfyUI-Bmad-DirtyUndoRedo is considered 'dirty' because it was implemented quickly without much concern for the 'right' way to do it. For example, the undo/redo data contains snapshots of the entire serialized workflow, which is overkill, and the developer does not plan to change this implementation.
